title: Assistant Facility Manager Job at Dana Group
content:
Dana Group is a major Nigerian conglomerate with a diverse range of businesses spanning manufacturing, aviation, automotive, and pharmaceuticals.It's known for its contributions to Nigeria's industrialization and has diversified into various sectors over its history.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Facility Manager

Job Location: Oshodi-Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced Assistant Facility Manager to join our team.
	As an Assistant Facility Manager, you'll play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation of our facilities, supporting our employees, and maintaining a safe and efficient work environment.


Responsibilities


	Assist the Facility Manager in overseeing daily facility operations, maintenance, and repairs
	Manage and perform routine maintenance and repairs of office equipment and systems, including:
	Air Conditioning (AC) systems
	Furniture and fixtures (e.g., chairs, tables, cabinets)
	Electrical systems and lighting
	Plumbing and water systems
	Supervising and guiding technicians and maintenance staff
	Assigning tasks and ensuring timely completion of work orders
	Providing training and development opportunities for team members
	Building maintenance and repairs (e.g., painting, carpentry, etc)
	Coordinate with vendors and contractors for larger maintenance and repair projects
	Lead and coordinate the facility team, including:
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations, building codes, and company policies
	Develop and implement facility management plans, budgets, and procedures
	Provide excellent customer service to employees, visitors, and stakeholders
	Monitor and control facility-related expenses and budgets
	Identify opportunities for cost savings and efficiency improvements


Requirements


	Minimum of 4 years of proven experience in a similar role.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in work.
	Basic knowledge of electrical, plumbing, and HVAC systems
	Strong knowledge of facility operations, maintenance, and management
	Excellent leadership, communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proximity to Isolo, Lagos State


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: vacancies@danagroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Customer Relation Officer Job at Domino Stores Limited
content:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Relation Officer

Responsibilties

title: Supervisor Job at Crescent Rice Mill Limited
content:
Crescent Rice Mill Limited is a leading rice processing company located at KM 15, Kano - Gumel Road, Jogana, Kano, Nigeria. With a vision to provide high-quality rice products to homes and businesses across Nigeria, we leverage advanced milling technology and a dedicated workforce to meet our customers' demands. We specialize in producing a variety of rice products, including Head Rice, Broken Rice, Reject Rice, Khus-Khus Rice, and Rice Bran. Our operations are strategically located in Kano, Nigeria’s commercial hub, enabling us to maintain efficient distribution channels across the nation.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Founded with a commitment to excellence and sustainability, Crescent Rice Mill Limited collaborates with local farmers to source premium rice paddy, ensuring that our processes support the agricultural community and promote economic development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supervisor

Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Duties and Responsibilities
Supervision and Training:


	Train and supervise operational staff to ensure they meet safety, quality, and productivity standards.
	Conduct regular training sessions for employees on safety protocols, equipment handling, and best operational practices.
	Provide ongoing coaching and performance evaluation for workers to improve efficiency and maintain high-quality output.
	Ensure that all team members understand their responsibilities and follow the company’s policies and standard operating procedures.


Production Oversight:


	Oversee rice milling operations, ensuring that production targets are met while minimizing waste and inefficiencies.
	Implement effective strategies to improve production speed and quality while maintaining cost efficiency.
	Work closely with other departments, including Quality Control and Maintenance, to ensure smooth production flow.
	Monitor raw material inputs, track production output, and identify areas for improvement to enhance operational effectiveness.


Quality Control and Compliance:


	Ensure all production activities adhere to industry quality control standards and company policies.
	Conduct routine inspections to verify that rice products meet company and regulatory specifications.
	Work closely with the Quality Control team to address any issues related to product defects or inconsistencies.
	Maintain compliance with food safety standards, including NAFDAC, SON, and other regulatory requirements.


Operational Efficiency and Reporting:


	Prepare and weeklyproduction reports detailing output, efficiency, and any operational challenges encountered.
	Implement measures to optimize raw material usage and minimize waste, ensuring cost-effective operations.
	Maintain accurate documentation of production activities, including machine performance, worker attendance, and any incidents or accidents.


Equipment and Facility Management:


	Ensure that all milling equipment is functioning properly and coordinate with the maintenance team for scheduled servicing and repairs.
	Monitor machinery performance and identify potential issues before they cause production delays.
	Implement preventive maintenance schedules to reduce equipment breakdowns and extend machine lifespan.
	Ensure cleanliness and proper organization of the production facility to maintain a safe and efficient working environment.


Health, Safety, and Staff Welfare:


	Enforce health and safety policies to protect workers from potential hazards in the production environment.
	Ensure that all employees wear appropriate protective gear and follow safety procedures at all times.
	Investigate and document any workplace accidents or incidents, recommending measures to prevent future occurrences.
	Promote a positive and productive work environment by addressing employee concerns and fostering teamwork.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's / Master`s Degree with 4 - 6 years of work experience. 


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.crescentricemill@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Audit Officer Job at Taeillo
content:
Taeillo is an e-commerce furniture and lifestyle brand that manufactures furniture by specializing in African-inspired designs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Audit Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Position


	We are looking for an internal auditor to provide guidance on financial accuracy, internal controls and regulatory compliance.


Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for examining and improving operating practices, and financial and risk management processes of the organization.
	handle corporate transparency by conducting audits, generating reports, and ensuring compliance. They analyze risks, monitor regulations, and maintain trust and communication with various departments.
	Developing, implementing and maintaining internal audit policies and procedures in accordance with local and international best practice.
	Identifying and reducing all business and financial risks through effective implementation and monitoring of controls.
	Conducting ad hoc investigations into identified or reported risks.
	Overall supervision of planned annual audits.
	Evaluate the design and effectiveness of internal controls, including segregation of duties, access controls, and authorization processes.
	Perform internal audits, reviews, and testing procedures to assess the reliability and accuracy of financial and operational information.
	Document audit findings, observations, and recommendations in audit reports, and communicate results to management and stakeholders.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or related fieldis required.
	5-7 years of work experience in a similar role.
	Proven experience in a manufacturing company will be a added advantage.
	Proven experience in internal auditing, internal controls, or risk management roles.
	Strong understanding of internal control principles, practices, and frameworks.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: peopleandculture@taeillo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Do not apply for this role if you do not have the above stated requirements.

title: Quality Control Officer Job at Erisco Foods Limited
content:
Erisco Foods Limited is an indigenous food product manufacturer, incorporated in Nigeria in 2004 and started operations in 2009, manufacturing Tomato Paste, Seasoning, Rice, Milk cubes and more. We are firmly committed to producing high-quality products that combine nourishment with value pricing, as they strive to become one of Nigeria’s largest indigenous foodmanufacturers on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Control Officer to ensure that our products meet internal and external quality standards.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for monitoring all production stages, ensuring that quality procedures are followed, and supporting continuous improvement initiatives.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspect raw materials, in-process, and finished products to ensure compliance with quality standards.
	Conduct routine quality control tests and maintain accurate records of results.
	Monitor and enforce hygiene and safety standards throughout the production process.
	Report any quality issues and work closely with production and maintenance teams for prompt resolution.
	Assist in the development and implementation of quality control procedures and documentation.
	Participate in internal audits and support regulatory inspections.
	Provide training to production staff on quality standards and procedures.


Qualifications and Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Food Science & Technology, Microbiology, Industrial Chemistry, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a quality control role within a manufacturing or FMCG environment.
	Strong knowledge of food safety standards (e.g., HACCP, ISO 22000).
	Attention to detail and excellent analytical skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a fast-paced production environment.
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
